accountSettingsWindow.accountNameRules: Account names cannot contain emoji or other special characters
accountSettingsWindow.changeOncePerSeason: You can only change this once per season.
accountSettingsWindow.changeOncePerSeasonError: You must wait until next season to change this again (${NUM} days)
accountSettingsWindow.linkAccountsInstructionsNewText:
To link two accounts, generate a code on the first
and enter that code on the second.  Data from the
second account will then be shared between both.
(Data from the first account will be lost)

You can link up to ${COUNT} accounts.

IMPORTANT: only link accounts that you own;
If you link with friends’ accounts you will not
be able to play online at the same time.
accountSettingsWindow.resetProgressConfirmNoAchievementsText:
This will reset your co-op progress and
local high-scores (but not your tickets).
This cannot be undone. Are you sure?
accountSettingsWindow.resetProgressConfirmText:
This will reset your co-op progress,
achievements, and local high-scores
(but not your tickets). This cannot
be undone. Are you sure?
accountSettingsWindow.setAccountNameDesc:
Select the name to display for your account.
You can use the name from one of your linked
accounts or create a unique custom name.
accountSettingsWindow.signInInfoText:
Sign in to collect tickets, compete online,
and share progress across devices.
accountSettingsWindow.signInWithDeviceInfoText: (an automatic account only available from this device)
accountSettingsWindow.signInWithTestAccountInfoText: (legacy account type; use device accounts going forward)
accountSettingsWindow.signInWithV2InfoText: (an account that works on all platforms)
accountSettingsWindow.signInWithV2Text: Sign in with a BombSquad account
accountSettingsWindow.v2LinkInstructionsText: Use this link to create an account or sign in.

audioSettingsWindow.soundtrackDescriptionText: (assign your own music to play during games)

bsRemoteConfigureInAppText: ${REMOTE_APP_NAME} is configured in the app itself.
canWeDebugText:
Would you like BombSquad to automatically report
bugs, crashes, and basic usage info to the developer?

This data contains no personal information and helps
keep the game running smoothly and bug-free.
completeThisLevelToProceedText:
You must complete
this level to proceed!

configGamepadSelectWindow.androidNoteText: Note: controller support varies by device and Android version.
configGamepadSelectWindow.pressAnyButtonText:
Press any button on the controller
 you want to configure...

configGamepadWindow.analogStickDeadZoneDescriptionText: (turn this up if your character 'drifts' when you release the stick)
configGamepadWindow.appliesToAllText: (applies to all controllers of this type)
configGamepadWindow.autoRecalibrateDescriptionText: (enable this if your character does not move at full speed)
configGamepadWindow.ifNothingHappensTryAnalogText: If nothing happens, try assigning to the analog stick instead.
configGamepadWindow.ifNothingHappensTryDpadText: If nothing happens, try assigning to the d-pad instead.
configGamepadWindow.ignoreCompletelyDescriptionText: (prevent this controller from affecting either the game or menus)
configGamepadWindow.ignoredButtonDescriptionText: (use this to prevent 'home' or 'sync' buttons from affecting the UI)
configGamepadWindow.runTriggerDescriptionText: (analog triggers let you run at variable speeds)
configGamepadWindow.secondHalfText:
Use this to configure the second half
of a 2-controllers-in-1 device that
shows up as a single controller.
configGamepadWindow.startButtonActivatesDefaultDescriptionTe: (turn this off if your start button is more of a 'menu' button)
configGamepadWindow.uiOnlyDescriptionText: (prevent this controller from actually joining a game)

configKeyboardWindow.keyboard2NoteText:
Note: most keyboards can only register a few keypresses at
once, so having a second keyboard player may work better
if there is a separate keyboard attached for them to use.
Note that you'll still need to assign unique keys to the
two players even in that case.

configTouchscreenWindow.swipeInfoText:
'Swipe' style controls take a little getting used to but
make it easier to play without looking at the controls.

connectMobileDevicesWindow.bestResultsText:
For best results you'll need a lag-free wifi network. You can
reduce wifi lag by turning off other wireless devices, by
playing close to your wifi router, and by connecting the
game host directly to the network via ethernet.
connectMobileDevicesWindow.explanationText:
To use a smart-phone or tablet as a wireless controller,
install the "${REMOTE_APP_NAME}" app on it. Any number of devices
can connect to a ${APP_NAME} game over Wi-Fi, and it's free!
connectMobileDevicesWindow.getItForText:
Get ${REMOTE_APP_NAME} for iOS at the Apple App Store
or for Android at the Google Play Store or Amazon Appstore

coopSelectWindow.activenessAllTimeInfoText: This does not apply to all-time rankings.
coopSelectWindow.activenessInfoText:
This multiplier rises on days when you
play and drops on days when you do not.
coopSelectWindow.challengesInfoText:
Earn prizes for completing mini-games.

Prizes and difficulty levels increase
each time a challenge is completed and
decrease when one expires or is forfeited.
coopSelectWindow.forfeitNotAllowedYetText: This challenge cannot be forfeited yet.
coopSelectWindow.proMultInfoText:
Players with the ${PRO} upgrade
receive a ${PERCENT}% point boost here.
coopSelectWindow.tournamentInfoText:
Compete for high scores with
other players in your league.

Prizes are awarded to the top scoring
players when tournament time expires.
coopSelectWindow.welcome1Text:
Welcome to ${LEAGUE}. You can improve your
league rank by earning star ratings, completing
achievements, and winning trophies in tournaments.
coopSelectWindow.welcome2Text:
You can also earn tickets from many of the same activities.
Tickets can be used to unlock new characters, maps, and
mini-games, to enter tournaments, and more.

creditsWindow.additionalAudioArtIdeasText: Additional Audio, Early Artwork, and Ideas by ${NAME}
creditsWindow.allMyFamilyText: All of my friends and family who helped play test
creditsWindow.softwareBasedOnText: This software is based in part on the work of ${NAME}

debugWindow.reloadBenchmarkBestResultsText: Note: it is recommended that you set Settings->Graphics->Textures to 'High' while testing this.
debugWindow.totalReloadTimeText: Total reload time: ${TIME} (see log for details)

difficultyHardUnlockOnlyText:
This level can only be unlocked in hard mode.
Do you think you have what it takes!?!?!
directBrowserToURLText: Please direct a web-browser to the following URL:
disableXInputDescriptionText: Allows more than 4 controllers but may not work as well.

editProfileWindow.accountProfileInfoText:
This special profile has a name
and icon based on your account.

${ICONS}

Create custom profiles to use
different names or custom icons.
editProfileWindow.globalProfileInfoText:
Global player profiles are guaranteed to have unique
names worldwide. They also include custom icons.
editProfileWindow.localProfileInfoText:
Local player profiles have no icons and their names are
not guaranteed to be unique. Upgrade to a global profile
to reserve a unique name and add a custom icon.
editProfileWindow.upgradeProfileInfoText:
This will reserve your player name worldwide
and allow you to assign a custom icon to it.

gatherWindow.aboutDescriptionLocalMultiplayerExtraTex:
Remember: any device in a party can have more
than one player if you have enough controllers.
gatherWindow.aboutDescriptionText:
Use these tabs to assemble a party.

Parties let you play games and tournaments
with your friends across different devices.

Use the ${PARTY} button at the top right to
chat and interact with your party.
(on a controller, press ${BUTTON} while in a menu)
gatherWindow.bluetoothAndroidSupportText: (works with any Android device supporting Bluetooth)
gatherWindow.dedicatedServerInfoText: For best results, set up a dedicated server. See bombsquadgame.com/server to learn how.
gatherWindow.disconnectClientsText:
This will disconnect the ${COUNT} player(s)
in your party. Are you sure?
gatherWindow.earnTicketsForRecommendingAmountText:
Friends will receive ${COUNT} tickets if they try the game
(and you will receive ${YOU_COUNT} for each who does)
gatherWindow.earnTicketsForRecommendingText:
Share the game
for free tickets...
gatherWindow.freeCloudServerAvailableMinutesText: Next free cloud server available in ${MINUTES} minutes.
gatherWindow.friendPromoCodeAwardText: You will receive ${COUNT} tickets each time it is used.
gatherWindow.friendPromoCodeExpireText: The code will expire in ${EXPIRE_HOURS} hours and only works for new players.
gatherWindow.friendPromoCodeInstructionsText:
To use it, open ${APP_NAME} and go to "Settings->Advanced->Enter Code".
See bombsquadgame.com for download links for all supported platforms.
gatherWindow.friendPromoCodeRedeemLongText: It can be redeemed for ${COUNT} free tickets by up to ${MAX_USES} people.
gatherWindow.friendPromoCodeRedeemShortText: It can be redeemed for ${COUNT} tickets in the game.
gatherWindow.googlePlayDescriptionText: Invite Google Play players to your party:
gatherWindow.googlePlayReInviteText:
There are ${COUNT} Google Play player(s) in your party
who will be disconnected if you start a new invite.
Include them in the new invitation to get them back.
gatherWindow.inDevelopmentWarningText:
Note:

Network play is a new and still-evolving feature.
For now, it is highly recommended that all
players be on the same Wi-Fi network.
gatherWindow.inviteAFriendText:
Friends don't have the game? Invite them to
try it and they'll receive ${COUNT} free tickets.
gatherWindow.localNetworkDescriptionText: Join a Nearby Party (LAN, Bluetooth, etc.)
gatherWindow.manualJoinableFromInternetText: Are you joinable from the internet?:
gatherWindow.manualRouterForwardingText: *to fix this, try configuring your router to forward UDP port ${PORT} to your local address
gatherWindow.partyInviteGooglePlayExtraText: (see the 'Google Play' tab in the 'Gather' window)
gatherWindow.partyInviteText:
${NAME} has invited
you to join their party!
gatherWindow.partyStatusJoinableText: your party is now joinable from the internet
gatherWindow.partyStatusNotJoinableText: your party is not joinable from the internet
gatherWindow.privatePartyCloudDescriptionText: Private parties run on dedicated cloud servers; no router configuration required.
gatherWindow.publicHostRouterConfigText: This may require configuring port-forwarding on your router. For an easier option, host a private party.
gatherWindow.startStopHostingMinutesText: You can start and stop hosting for free for the next ${MINUTES} minutes.
gatherWindow.wifiDirectDescriptionBottomText:
If all devices have a 'Wi-Fi Direct' panel, they should be able to use it to find
and connect to each other.  Once all devices are connected, you can form parties
here using the 'Local Network' tab, just the same as with a regular Wi-Fi network.

For best results, the Wi-Fi Direct host should also be the ${APP_NAME} party host.
gatherWindow.wifiDirectDescriptionTopText:
Wi-Fi Direct can be used to connect Android devices directly without
needing a Wi-Fi network. This works best on Android 4.2 or newer.

To use it, open Wi-Fi settings and look for 'Wi-Fi Direct' in the menu.
gatherWindow.worksWithGooglePlayDevicesText: (works with devices running the Google Play (android) version of the game)
gatherWindow.youHaveBeenSentAPromoCodeText: You have been sent a ${APP_NAME} promo code:

getTicketsWindow.inProgressText: A transaction is in progress; please try again in a moment.
getTicketsWindow.unavailableLinkAccountText:
Sorry, purchases are not available on this platform.
As a workaround, you can link this account to an account on
another platform and make purchases there.
getTicketsWindow.unavailableTemporarilyText: This is currently unavailable; please try again later.
getTicketsWindow.versionTooOldText: Sorry, this version of the game is too old; please update to a newer one.

googleMultiplayerDiscontinuedText:
Sorry, Google’s multiplayer service is no longer available.
I am working on a replacement as fast as possible.
Until then, please try another connection method.
-Eric
googlePlayPurchasesNotAvailableText:
Google Play purchases are not available.
You may need to update your store app.

helpWindow.bombInfoText:
- Bomb -
Stronger than punches, but
can result in grave self-injury.
For best results, throw towards
enemy before fuse runs out.
helpWindow.controllersInfoText:
You can play ${APP_NAME} with friends over a network, or you
can all play on the same device if you have enough controllers.
${APP_NAME} supports a variety of them; you can even use phones
as controllers via the free '${REMOTE_APP_NAME}' app.
See Settings->Controllers for more info.
helpWindow.controllersInfoTextRemoteOnly:
You can play ${APP_NAME} with friends over a network, or you
can all play on the same device by using phones as
controllers via the free '${REMOTE_APP_NAME}' app.
helpWindow.controlsSubtitleText: Your friendly ${APP_NAME} character has a few basic actions:
helpWindow.devicesInfoText:
The VR version of ${APP_NAME} can be played over the network with
the regular version, so whip out your extra phones, tablets,
and computers and get your game on.  It can even be useful to
connect a regular version of the game to the VR version just to
allow people outside to watch the action.
helpWindow.friendsGoodText:
These are good to have.  ${APP_NAME} is most fun with several
players and can support up to 8 at a time, which leads us to:
helpWindow.jumpInfoText:
- Jump -
Jump to cross small gaps,
to throw things higher, and
to express feelings of joy.
helpWindow.orPunchingSomethingText: Or punching something, throwing it off a cliff, and blowing it up on the way down with a sticky bomb.
helpWindow.pickUpInfoText:
- Pick Up -
Grab flags, enemies, or anything
else not bolted to the ground.
Press again to throw.
helpWindow.powerupBombDescriptionText:
Lets you whip out three bombs
in a row instead of just one.
helpWindow.powerupCurseDescriptionText:
You probably want to avoid these.
 ...or do you?
helpWindow.powerupHealthDescriptionText:
Restores you to full health.
You'd never have guessed.
helpWindow.powerupIceBombsDescriptionText:
Weaker than normal bombs
but leave your enemies frozen
and particularly brittle.
helpWindow.powerupImpactBombsDescriptionText:
Slightly weaker than regular
bombs, but they explode on impact.
helpWindow.powerupPunchDescriptionText:
Makes your punches harder,
faster, better, stronger.
helpWindow.powerupShieldDescriptionText:
Absorbs a bit of damage
so you don't have to.
helpWindow.powerupStickyBombsDescriptionText:
Stick to anything they hit.
Hilarity ensues.
helpWindow.powerupsSubtitleText: Of course, no game is complete without powerups:
helpWindow.punchInfoText:
- Punch -
Punches do more damage the
faster your fists are moving, so
run and spin like a madman.
helpWindow.runInfoText:
- Run -
Hold ANY button to run. Triggers or shoulder buttons work well if you have them.
Running gets you places faster but makes it hard to turn, so watch out for cliffs.
helpWindow.someDaysText: Some days you just feel like punching something.  Or blowing something up.
helpWindow.toGetTheMostText: To get the most out of this game, you'll need:

hostIsNavigatingMenusText: - ${HOST} is navigating menus like a boss -

ps3ControllersWindow.macInstructionsText:
Switch off the power on the back of your PS3, make sure
Bluetooth is enabled on your Mac, then connect your controller
to your Mac via a USB cable to pair the two. From then on, you
can use the controller's home button to connect it to your Mac
in either wired (USB) or wireless (Bluetooth) mode.

On some Macs you may be prompted for a passcode when pairing.
If this happens, see the following tutorial or google for help.




PS3 controllers connected wirelessly should show up in the device
list in System Preferences->Bluetooth. You may need to remove them
from that list when you want to use them with your PS3 again.

Also make sure to disconnect them from Bluetooth when not in
use or their batteries will continue to drain.

Bluetooth should handle up to 7 connected devices,
though your mileage may vary.
ps3ControllersWindow.ouyaInstructionsText:
To use a PS3 controller with your OUYA, simply connect it with a USB cable
once to pair it.  Doing this may disconnect your other controllers, so
you should then restart your OUYA and unplug the USB cable.

From then on you should be able to use the controller's HOME button to
connect it wirelessly. When you are done playing, hold the HOME button
for 10 seconds to turn the controller off; otherwise it may remain on
and waste batteries.

remoteAppInfoShortText:
${APP_NAME} is most fun when played with family & friends.
Connect one or more hardware controllers or install the
${REMOTE_APP_NAME} app on phones or tablets to use them
as controllers.

remote_app.description:
Use your phone or tablet as a controller with BombSquad.
Up to 8 devices can connect at once for epic local multiplayer madness on a single TV or tablet.
remote_app.game_full: The game is full or not accepting connections.
remote_app.searching_caption:
Tap on the name of a game to join it.
Make sure you are on the same wifi network as the game.
remote_app.version_mismatch:
Version mismatch.
Make sure BombSquad and BombSquad Remote
are the latest versions and try again.

store.bombSquadProNewDescriptionText:
• Removes in-game ads and nag-screens
• Unlocks more game settings
• Also includes:
store.freeBombSquadProText:
BombSquad is now free, but since you originally purchased it you are
receiving the BombSquad Pro upgrade and ${COUNT} tickets as a thank-you.
Enjoy the new features, and thank you for your support!
-Eric
store.howToUseIconsText: (create global player profiles (in the account window) to use these)
store.howToUseMapsText: (use these maps in your own teams/free-for-all playlists)

storeDescriptionText:
8 Player Party Game Madness!

Blow up your friends (or the computer) in a tournament of explosive mini-games such as Capture-the-Flag, Bomber-Hockey, and Epic-Slow-Motion-Death-Match!

Simple controls and extensive controller support make it easy for up to 8 people to get in on the action; you can even use your mobile devices as controllers via the free ‘BombSquad Remote’ app!

Bombs Away!

Check out www.froemling.net/bombsquad for more info.

storeDescriptions.competeInMiniGamesText: Compete in mini-games ranging from racing to flying.
storeDescriptions.customize2Text: Customize characters, mini-games, and even the soundtrack.
storeDescriptions.customizeText: Customize characters and create your own mini-game playlists.
storeDescriptions.sportsMoreFunText: Sports are more fun with explosives.

testBuildErrorText: This test build is no longer active; please check for a new version.
testBuildValidateErrorText: Unable to validate test build. (no net connection?)
thankYouText: Thank you for your support! Enjoy the game!!
tournamentEndedText: This tournament has ended. A new one will start soon.
tournamentsDisabledWorkspaceText:
Tournaments are disabled when workspaces are active.
To re-enable tournaments, disable your workspace and restart.

tutorial.cpuBenchmarkText: Running tutorial at ludicrous-speed (primarily tests CPU speed)
tutorial.phrase03Text: Here's a few tips for controlling your character:
tutorial.phrase04Text: Many things in ${APP_NAME} are PHYSICS based.
tutorial.phrase06Text: ..damage is based on the speed of your fists.
tutorial.phrase07Text: See? We weren't moving, so that barely hurt ${NAME}.
tutorial.phrase08Text: Now let's jump and spin to get more speed.
tutorial.phrase11Text: Hold down ANY button to run.
tutorial.phrase12Text: For extra-awesome punches, try running AND spinning.
tutorial.phrase14Text: You can pick up and throw things such as flags.. or ${NAME}.
tutorial.phrase17Text: Ouch! Not a very good throw.
tutorial.phrase20Text: "Whiplash" your bombs for even longer throws.
tutorial.phrase21Text: Timing your bombs can be tricky.
tutorial.phrase23Text: Try "cooking off" the fuse for a second or two.
tutorial.phrase27Text: Remember your training, and you WILL come back alive!
tutorial.skipConfirmText: Really skip the tutorial? Tap or press to confirm.
tutorial.toSkipPressAnythingText: (tap or press anything to skip tutorial)

unlockThisInTheStoreText: This must be unlocked in the store.

upgradeToPlayText: Unlock "${PRO}" in the in-game store to play this.
usesExternalControllerText: This game uses an external controller for input.

watchWindow.replayRenameErrorAlreadyExistsText: A replay with that name already exists.

wiimoteListenWindow.pressText2: On newer Wiimotes with Motion Plus built in, press the red 'sync' button on the back instead.

wiimoteSetupWindow.macInstructionsText:
Make sure your Wii is off and Bluetooth is enabled
on your Mac, then press 'Listen'. Wiimote support can
be a bit flaky, so you may have to try a few times
before you get a connection.

Bluetooth should handle up to 7 connected devices,
though your mileage may vary.

BombSquad supports the original Wiimotes, Nunchuks,
and the Classic Controller.
The newer Wii Remote Plus now works too
but not with attachments.
wiimoteSetupWindow.thanksText:
Thanks to the DarwiinRemote team
For making this possible.

workspaceSyncErrorText: Error syncing ${WORKSPACE}. See log for details.
workspaceSyncReuseText: Can't sync ${WORKSPACE}. Reusing previous synced version.

xbox360ControllersWindow.macInstructions2Text:
To use controllers wirelessly, you'll also need the receiver that
comes with the 'Xbox 360 Wireless Controller for Windows'.
One receiver allows you to connect up to 4 controllers.

Important: 3rd-party receivers will not work with this driver;
make sure your receiver says 'Microsoft' on it, not 'XBOX 360'.
Microsoft no longer sells these separately, so you'll need to get
the one bundled with the controller or else search ebay.

If you find this useful, please consider a donation to the
driver developer at his site.
xbox360ControllersWindow.macInstructionsText:
To use Xbox 360 controllers, you'll need to install
the Mac driver available at the link below.
It works with both wired and wireless controllers.
xbox360ControllersWindow.ouyaInstructionsText:
To use wired Xbox 360 controllers with BombSquad, simply
plug them into your device's USB port.  You can use a USB hub
to connect multiple controllers.

To use wireless controllers you'll need a wireless receiver,
available as part of the "Xbox 360 wireless Controller for Windows"
package or sold separately. Each receiver plugs into a USB port and
allows you to connect up to 4 wireless controllers.
